revised_title: Anatomical and Dental Analysis of the Placodus Laticeps and Other Species
tldr: The author examines the skull and teeth of the Placodus laticeps and other species, providing evidence that they are Saurian reptiles. He describes the unique dentition and cranial anatomy, comparing them to other extinct reptiles and analyzing their adaptations for crushing hard substances. The author also discusses the microscopic structure of the teeth and describes new species of Placodus.
